definition: to accomplish one's ambition/a dream come true/to enjoy success
to obtain/to get/to gain/to catch (a disease)/proper/suitable/proud/contented/to allow/to permit/ready/finished
structural particle: used after a verb (or adjective as main verb), linking it to following phrase indicating effect, degree, possibility etc
to have to/must/ought to/to need to
aspiration/ambition/the will
sign/mark/to record/to write a footnote
soured by the loss of one's hopes
lit. a vile character flourishes (idiom)/fig. an inferior person gets into a position of power, becoming conceited and arrogant

sentences.english: This in turn blighted his middle years.
sentences.chinese: 这最终使他在中年郁郁不得志。

sentences.english: He is very persuasive and you need to be pretty strong-minded to say no to him.
sentences.chinese: 他很善于说服人，得志很坚强的人才能跟他说不。

sentences.english: The second is the unsuccessful scholars' spiritual sustenance and restructuring of the value.
sentences.chinese: 不得志文人的精神寄托和价值重构之所。

sentences.english: He who delights in slaughter will not succeed in his ambition to rule the world.
sentences.chinese: 夫乐杀人者，则不可以得志于天下矣。

sentences.english: Deng Guida's colleague Huang Dezhi was also wounded in the incident.
sentences.chinese: 邓贵大同事黄得志也一同受伤。

sentences.english: The consequence of your failing is to make flunkies achieve their ambition while talents shed tears.
sentences.chinese: 你学不会的结果是小人得志，人才流泪。

sentences.english: Most actors toil in obscurity, never stepping into the spotlight.
sentences.chinese: 大多数演员都郁郁不得志，从未真正站到舞台中央。
你对现在的生活得志吗？

sentences.english: He thought too much of himself and was getting too big for his boots, though he kept his thoughts to himself.
sentences.chinese: 他少年得志，目中无人，不过没有表露出来。

sentences.english: Here bad people hold sway while good people suffer and justice is trodden down underfoot.
sentences.chinese: 在这里坏人得志，好人受苦，正义受到摧残。

sentences.english: Red chardonnay was frustrated in the restaurant drink, was the shopkeeper for arrears.
sentences.chinese: 赤霞郁郁不得志的在酒家喝酒，却被掌柜追讨欠款。

sentences.english: The film hero is a rather Tanner blossom actor.
sentences.chinese: 本片主人公丹拿是一个颇不得志的演员。

sentences.english: When you're up and well, remember to keep your feet down.
sentences.chinese: 当你得志的时候，记得保持脚踏实地。

sentences.english: The last months and days of Simon Bolivar, the brilliant and thwarted liberator of South America.
sentences.chinese: 南美洲卓越但不得志的解放者波利瓦尔最后一段时日。

definition: flushed with success/proud of one's success (in exams, promotion etc)/as pleased as punch
soured by the loss of one's hopes
disappointed/frustrated
fully content with one's achievements (idiom)/complacent
lit. a vile character flourishes (idiom)/fig. an inferior person gets into a position of power, becoming conceited and arrogant
to have talent but no opportunity (idiom)/to be an unrecognized talent
bossy and domineering/throwing one's weight about
to have reached the highest official positions
to win power/to get authority/to become dominant
so pleased as to lose one's sense of measure/beside oneself with joy
lit. the divine steed Feihuang gallops (idiom)/fig. to achieve meteoric success in one's career
to hold power
official career (formal)
to curry favor (idiom); playing up to those in power/social climbing
proud/arrogant
to think too much of oneself/self-important/arrogant
